caption: Fantastic food, amazing service! Very knowledgeable Sommelier and love the ambiance!

This spot is the one I always prefer. I go to many restaurants but here I go the most. The team is very friendly and the food they cook is so delicious. I never miss an opportunity to have a nice meal in this restaurant. Highly recommended.

last night was our first time we came to that excellent restaurant. But It is definitely not the last. We enjoyed the evening a lot with the excellent service, with the excellent cooking and wine and with the decent charge. We will absolutely come back in a short time.
I regularly stop by buying some food here. I enjoyed the speedy customer service and well prepared dishes. Highly recommended.
Top notch! Always an amazing meal. Can't go wrong with anything in the menu.
This place obviously knows how to serve their clients. Always with a friendly approach. The food is reasonably priced, always fresh and clean.
Really great steak salad.  Very busy at noon. Come a half hour prior and you still find seating.   Will return soon to try the rest of the menu
Had a great experience in this spot with my wife. The food arrived rapidly and the service is just fantastic. Prices are convenient.

I dine in this lovely spot from time to time! This is my favorite place to to have a good dinner.  I go there many times. The food is excellent, the workers are professional and the rates are affordable. I enjoy eating in this spot for a rich supper.
This spot is awesome! Convenient prices, large portions and the staff are consistently nice.
The sushi was good and but service could be improved on.
I really enjoyed their food. I always get great customer service there. The place is clean and the workers are always helpful. Will come visit again.
The customer service is constantly rapid, fantastic atmosphere, helpful staff. Will come back again when I arrive nearby.

I visit this restaurant from time to time! This is my favorite spot to eat.  I go there routinely. The food is very good, the team is helpful and the rates are good. I like being in this spot for a decent supper.
It was one of the finest restaurants I’ve ever been to. You should check this place out. Perfect for a date night or family dinner.
Good place to host business meeting. Good quality sushi and even better rolls.

I often take my friends to this restaurant with my highest recommendations. I visit this place often. I get very good feedback from my friends. The meals are flavorable and the crew is very friendly and cooperative. Every time  we eat in this place we enjoy a pleasing time.  I recommend this place with pleasure.
Great place. Nice food and good service.

Two of us went here for lunch and it was busy so we sat at the bar. Ordered Bento boxes and after 25 minutes, nothing. Asked server and she said meal would be right up. 15 minutes later - still nothing. Finally spoke to manager and they never told us what happened but we had to take it to go because we only had an hour. Server never even asked if she could refill our drinks during this entire time. Comped us our soft drinks whoopie! Food was adequate but service was about as bad as it gets. At least check on us once in a while please.

Food was okay, but not great. The service was beyond bad for the price(set lunch with three courses for a Michelin star restaurant in Chicago is avg $24 - 30 ). This place is definitely Michelin star prices. We had a reservation at 11:45am. We were kind of on time, 5 mins early. We sat down around 11:40am. Soon after we finished eating, a lady come by our table and told us we have to leave(around 12:30pm). The restaurant was busy, but it was not like that's no empty table. She made us feel like we did something wrong like we were there for too long. We were only there for 50 mins.  If we were there and not buying, I can understand. But our bill was $67 for the three of us. We asked why we have to leave right the way, and she told us there was a computer problem and they were overbooked. But when we walk out, there was no line and there was empty tables. If you are looking for a nice sit down place, it is not the place you want to go, as there's a timer on every table. If you are looking for place to eat quick, you can go somewhere cheaper.
Went there with my coworkers. Food quality was exceptional even though they were quite busy. I ordered Tuna Avacado salad
Creative, first rate sushi. Fair price for the quality. Solid service.

Crazy good spot for a sushi lunch. So much good sushi and sashimi here, and entrees to satisfy any additional hankering you have. I had a tuna and avocado salad, amazing. A friend ordered the "best risotto I've ever had!" Risotto at a sushi restaurant, go figure. But all of it great, in a restaurant full of intriguing original art not to mention other eager diners, so get a reservation for sure.
Great sushi
I love this place a lot. there is a very nice atmosphere. The food is good. the service is efficient and the crew is well trained. The pay is satisfactory. I warmly recommend.

I told my friends about this restaurant with my highest recommendations. I go their often. I get very good feedback from my friends. The dishes they serve are appetizing and the team is very friendly and cooperative. Every time  we go to this place we enjoy a cheerful evening.  warmly recommended.
Better than I remembered it from last time. Also has nice quiet couch seating for drinks.
They offer a vast variety of delicious food. I liked eating here. The employees are always very nice, rates are convenient and the spot is always kept clean.
(Translated by Google) French and Japanese fusion, clean and boss friendly  (Original) 프렌치와 일식의 퓨전, 깔끔하고 사장님이 친절하심
Food was just OK, the decor a bit off, and the couch in the lobby - really? Hey manager, have you looked at it recently?
Excellent happy hour specials. Delicious sushi and Asian fusion good.

(Translated by Google) Chicago Korea & Japan Fusion Restaurant  The overall atmosphere is good for the price It is an oriental fusion food, but it is popular with locals.  You can eat a wide variety of foods and tastes.  It is also home to kimchi and other mainland flavors.  If you want Korean food in Chicago, I recommend you visit.  (Original) 시카고 코리아&일본 퓨전 레스토랑  전반적인 분위기가 가격에 비해서 좋고 동양 퓨전음식이지만 현지인들이 많이 찾는 곳이다.  다양한 음식을 먹을수 있고 맛 또한 어떤 메뉴를 선택하던 중간이상 맛볼 수 있는 집이다.  김치 등 본토의 맛을 내는 집이기도 하다.  시카고 내에서 코리아 풍의 음식을 먹길 원한다면 방문하는 것을 추천한다.
Went here for lunch. Food was great. Every sushi dish we tried was delicious and well-presented. Ambience is nice, service excellent. Definitely coming back.
Nice place...found it by searching places to it as I was in town for work. Good service and food was delish.
Perfect staff and atmosphere. Wish I would have had more time to fully enjoy it

I visited AarOn for a business lunch this past week. We had a reservation for noon and were seated directly. Our server was very attentive and took and brought our drinks right away as well as took our lunch orders. The space was a little dark but pretty quiet and great for lunch conversation with clients or coworkers. Our lunch was delicious - I had the salmon bento box and my coworker had the strip steak bento box. The food was well portioned and freshly prepared. We were not rushed out of the restaurant and I fully enjoyed our meal. I would definitely go back.
Excellent food.
Pork belly is insanely good.

We had an absolutely wonderful time at AarOn! The service was prompt, revelatant and friendly and the wine was delicious and fairly priced. The sushi, especially the Angry Crab 🦀, was scrumptious! 10/10 would recommend and go again, we went in the evening and had such a splendid time. Thank you!
Delicious food, good casual space and nice staff
Great happy hour!
The staff was friendly and this place has a chill vibe that makes going there fun. Delicious food!
Love love love!!
AraOn has incredibly delicious dishes. The sushi is amazing, the shabu shabu has a rich broth that pairs well with the pork belly.
Fine upscale Japanese restaurant. Great food & nice  presentation.
Good food and chill vibe
One of my favorite for business lunches. It has an interesting decor as well as an innovative Asian -French fusion menu.
Their "tower" is incredible!
Pricey, but ok.
Great food,Chef Jimmy is the best.
Interesting mix of Asian fusion choices. Sushi superb. Great flavors in Korean inflected dishes. Overall visually thoughtful. Attentive service
Great sushi...rolls are big and fantastic! The executive chef is phenomenal... Highly recommend!
Food was AMAZING!! My server Ben was very patient and answered all of my questions about my choices. Was very beautiful inside. Will def be back

We came in an hour before closing and this place was nothing but class. We sampled some sushi and I enjoyed the bibimbap. The fish in the bibimbap was mouth watering. The service, again, was top rate and the staff was very knowledgeable of the dishes. The only reason i couldnt give this place a 5 star review was that my rock bowl was not hot (warm enough to handle freely) and so the rice developed no sort of crust on the bottom. Please give this place a try.
Excellent! !!!!

AraOn is an exceptional place for a diverse dining experience. I'm continually amazed at the variety of dishes and the care the owner who is also executive chef takes to ensure the comfort of his guests.
Fantastic sushi. Great spot for business lunch or dinner date.
The bento box hit the spot.

Food is great and it's a nice sushi place in the loop if you don't feel like trekking all the way out to River North or something. It's clean and spacious, but I don't care for the leather sofa or in the walkway, it's kind of gross looking. Luckily the wall art is intricately pleasing. The hosts and servers were attentive and kind, but the other staff didn't seem happy to be there. Definitely coming back for great nigiri but service and aesthetic could use consideration.

Excellent staff! It was a really busy time when I went in but they were on point. The dish i ordered was absolutely amazing. I would love to visit this place again and try the other things in their menu as well. The place has a very different ambience that makes you feel very lively while you're there.
Great sushi. Must order the angry crab roll!
Great service

This is the best Korean fusion restaurant I ever visited in my life! This is kind of a hidden gem  Asian fusion restaurant located in Downtown Chicago. As a korean I recommend this place both for korean and non Asian who wants to expose to high end fusion style!
Great meal as always. Good sushi and generous portions. Funny and enthusiastic staff. Never hard to get a table.
This place was amazing. Outstanding service great food.  If I ever come to Chicago again I would stop here.
Great happy hour special and attentive staff

Great selection of sushi and nigiri. Entrée (healthy salmon) was OK. Service was mediocre - inattentive but pleasant when they were around, perhaps they were short staffed. Enjoyed a complimentary appetizer which was a nice welcome touch.
because this restaurant, I always stay at w hotel, next door. every time I come to Chicago.

My sashami was tasteless, the wasabi gritty and had a funky taste. Really a very bad experience. Mentioned the taste issue, just got cursory reply. $100 just so I could walk 2 blocks before it all came back up. Felt better 2 hours later, so this was not a "bug". Will not go back.

Unique and beautiful food, great service, cozy and artistic interior. The owner is the executive chef and is super friendly. Definitely coming back here when I'm in the town again. Really appreciated the amazing evening here.

The service here was impeccable. The executive chef came around to every table to talk about each aspect of the dishes. Everyone was incredibly kind. The food had exotic Japanese and Korean flavors combined in unique ways. Everything was amazing and the people made the experience 10X better. I would absolutely recommend for any occasion, big or small.
Excellent portions, edamame is fantastic!
The atmosphere and food was great. I really enjoyed their Sushi.
Good restaurant for a quick weekday business luncheon meetings. Reliably good food served with a smile.
Great cousine and a wonderful serving. And Jimmy is such a wonderful guy!;)
Food is delicious and services are good and friendly!

Really great experience. Went here randomly after reading yelp reviews. The did was absolutely amazing. Service could have been a bit more on it but otgerwise, worth it.  Ordered the the Ara on chef special, Araon tower, and they gave us a complimentary sampler that was really delicious.
Rare that you find the combination of amazing food and truly genuine warm and welcoming service .. what a wonderful experience.

Might be ok for lunch, but I was in the loop and wanted to eat somewhere for dinner a few weeks ago and stopped in one day. The ambience is definitely lacking since it's built inside an office building with no windows. Also feels like it was decorated in the 80s. I remember one roll I had that was around $16 or so and not good. It was slow at the time I was there and the waitress wasn't busy but disappeared for 15 minutes at some point when I really wanted my check. I will not be back. If you want good sushi just leave the loop and go literally anywhere else.
I liked the fusion of foods. Good lunch spot.
Over priced! Understaffed! Terrible customer experience. Food is ok
The food is really nice. The environment is clean, nice and stylish. It would be great if beef in Bibimbap can be a bit more tender.

First time here, but will definitely be back! Excellent food, prompt and attentive service. I had the bimbimbop, which was topped with a perfect piece of salmon instead of the egg I had come to expect on this dish. It was outstanding! Highly recommended.
Highly recommend this restaurant, great quality food and excellent service!!!
Good food but a very limited menu outside of sushi.
Amazing Restaurant, tasty and delightful menu [great options] and overall Good Service. ✨👌😌
Service a touch slow, but was noon rush. Bento box was good. Wife enjoyed her dragon roll.
The owner made us some amazing items he was testing out.  It's a hidden gem and could almost be a speakeasy.
Exceptional cuisine and service

Second time here, 1st just me and my husband,  this time with our daughter.  Incredible service and tasty maki rolls. While it was midweek with a heavy after work business crowd,  they catered to my family and especially our daughter. Selena was pleasant and always smiling. Even though there weren't many kid friendly menu items Jimmy (the owner) made a special dish not on the menu for our daughter that she loved. Top notch service going above and beyond to make me and my family feel like their special guests. We highly recommend it!
Food and Service were Excellent!!!

This was one of the best meals I ever had. We were out for a business dinner and wanted to share plates. We asked for recommendations and the chef came out to suggest sushi and kitchen food. What then happened was just a festival of good food. Totally recommend this place!
Food is very good but a little pricey
Overpriced for what you get
First time there and I enjoyed my experience.

Everything we got here was amazing-the food and service. We had teriyaki salmon, black cod, and the AraOn chef special sushi roll. We were starving and pretty much licked the plates clean! The chef/owner took time out to come chat with us. It was really nice to get to know Jimmy! Oh! And we finished with the green tea creme brulee...OMG! It was soooo good! Don't skip dessert!!
Good sushi spot in the loop
Great food and service!
Neither good nor cheap food. Don’t want to pass too much judgment based on one dish, but the chirashi was sub par and $29 for lunch. Server was very nice though.
Liked it. Didn't love it.
Slow lunch service.  Waitress entered order wrong.  It took nearly an hour to finally get the correct order.  Only offered a 10% discount AFTER we asked.

What a great spot! The service is unmatched and the staff is very attentive. The sushi is very fresh and next level. The flavors are unique and pleasant. The owner even came out and was saying hi to the tables. Talk about a man who cares and pours his heart into his business! I am from our of town, but I'll be back!

This is a hidden gem in Chicago. While I would rather less people knew about it so I could have it to myself on the weekdays when I'm in town, this place deserves far more attention. Some of the best Sashmi I have had...period....The quality of each and every item I have had on the menu has been amazing. The staff is so very wonderful and it has one of the best Saki Menu's I've seen. Give it a try but don't go too often because I want a table :P
Excellent service, food, and the price compared to restaurants around it
Service was really slow. I don’t have 3 hours for lunch.
Wonderful food at reasonable prices

Very impressed by this restaurant. Great decor, great, friendly staff and great food. Very convenient to both the W hotel and JW Marriott in downtown Chicago. I found this to be one of the better restaurants I have been to in Chicago, I could go on and on, I definitely recommend this place
Went here for happy hour
Narrow selection, but nice ambience inside.
Great experience! Chef / owner Jimmy Kim is a wonderful host. The ambience is trendy but unpretentious. The food is excellent. The staff is on top of things. Not inexpensive but a very good value.
Good sushi, gets crowded at lunch, make reservations.
Decent selection of Japanese options on their lunchtime menu. Staff was nice and attentive. Price was moderate.
Great place!
Good food and ambience
The sushi is the best ever!
Super nice and friendly Chief, he gave us a lot of hidden amazing food
Great lunch spot
Delicious!

This should be listed as a Japanese restaurant or at least fusion rather than French. It's a solid choice if you want to take someone to a nice lunch downtown for a good price. The bento boxes are a great choice if you want to try a little bit of everything.
Excellent place to get some drinks and/or food. We came here for some wine after dinner. Loved it. Ambiance is very good.
So delicious! They brought us a piece of sushi before our meal to try, which was nice and tasted great. Seaweed salad is delicious!
Extensive menu. Noisy and full tables. Fantastic service ND quick.(though the folks in the front could be friendlier). The sushi was perfect. Good find and would definitely recommend.
Very rude staff! Will never return!
Try the bento box
Service a bit slow. Sushi Roles were good, but nigiri was thin and sad looking. Would have expected to pay half as much considering the quality.
Great Ribs and sushi
Best duck dumplings ever!!!
Had the AarOn tower and a rice beer.  Delicious,  if a bit pricer than most.
Amazing food!!! Highly recommended!!! Best experience possible!!!Chef came to our table to teach us how to eat the pork meal. Love it!!!! AMAZING!!!

GREAT experience at such a trendy, beautiful affordable place! The owner came over, introduced himself, and sent over two plates of free sushi! NYC vibes, friendly staff, perfect for young professionals and families alike. Extensive menu with lots to choose from- my dragon roll and sticky rice were my personal favorites but the waitress made stellar recommendations for my friends. Will DEFINITELY be back (:
Good place for casual business meetings
Great Sushi and the staff was very friendly even though I came in 20 minutes before they closed.
Fresh fish and top rate dining. The sashimi bibimbap is amazing!
Had sashimi plate. Fish was at proper temperature, medium large portion size, selection was good but nothing especially memorable
Good food,  touristy spartan decor

This is an easy option for a business lunch in the loop. The food and service are good but nothing is exceptional. I have never left disappointed about anything and have been more than a dozen times. Not too loud so conversation is natural. When you can't get a table the bar area is even pretty good seating.
Great breakfast

Wow. What a wonderful experience. I didn't realize there was such a beautiful and elegant sushi restaurant in the Loop! My wife and I came for date night and I was immediately impressed by the spacious and really tasteful interior.  The service was impeccable and our sushi was fresh and tasty. I felt the prices were about right for the level of service and quality of the food we had. But what made the experience standout was meeting the owner. He came by to see how we were doing and his friendly demeanor immediately made us feel like old friends.  You can tell this place is his pride and joy and he works hard to make sure everyone has a top-notch experience. I highly recommend this restaurant for a business meal or a nice night on the town!
Good food and good service

Great service and food.  Sit at the bar and sometimes the chefs will chat it up and/or give you free bites.  The sashimi bibimbap is a fantastic value if you're really hungry, but the AraOn tower is one of my favorite dishes ever.

It was open for dinner in this area that is full of lunch only spots.    Sushi was fine.  Beef with broccoli was good, uniquely prepared . Could have used some more sauce.  Service was good.  If there had been anyplace else within a few blocks and it hadn't been so cold, I probably would have ventured onward to another option.

One of the best sushi restaurants I have eaten at. I loved the French flare. The executive chef came to our table several times to see how we were doing and personally made us some yummy dishes to try that we hadn't ordered. Later we moved to the bar area and when our friend showed up to eat but the kitchen had already closed. The chef was walking out the door with his jacket and backpack for the night. He put everything down went into the kitchen and made 3 of the most delicious hand rolls for him at no charge. He said everyone deserves a good meal. We could not have had better service or a more delicious meal. It's a popular lunch spot so it was nice to have a quiet dinner with star treatment. I highly highly recommend!
Best sushi in town, you pretty much can go wrong with anything on the menu. Great atmosphere too
Decent sushi.  Usually empty so service is quick.
It's good for and quiet which was nice for the evening.
Best pork chop I have ever had in the US
Great food for the price
Great space

Great food. They have real Wasabi instead of regular horseradish with coloring. Sushi wasn't exquisite, but for the price, it was great. The service was just right that I find it very pleasant. The style of food is more Korean with Japanese tweak, but as a Korean, it was refreshing and tasty. Generally Korean food is very salty but this restaurant managed to make fusion Korean food with deep taste without overly making it salty. I would definitely visit again if I live around here.
Fabulous sushi, the staff was wonderful, the chef even came to our table to make sure everything was prepared correctly. All around great find in the Loop.
I always make a point to go when I'm in Chicago . Always fresh fish , best service .
Great for quick sushi lunch. One of the sushi combos I have experienced, though a bit spendy. Make reservations unless you want to sit at the sushi bar, even at lunch!

I might be the only one that thinks it's weird to get mashed potatoes with a stir fry of tofu and veggies.... but I also am not the biggest fan of potatoes in general. Maybe I'm a traditionalist, but I think an option of rice with the sizzle plates would be great. Otherwise I think they have very well seasoned tofu for a reasonable price in the loop.
Small menu
Good service,  reasonable price good sushi quality
great korean style restaurant.. not traditional but enjoyable.
Pretty good night. Owner kicked a wayward hobo in the face that walked in. yeah!!!
Had the Chef Special AraOn roll!  So great!
Disappointing. Sushi was alright, but nothing great, overpriced for what I received. Ceviche was the bright spot of our meal.

I'd highly recommend their sandwiches. The sushi is pretty good as well. I've been here a number of times for work lunches, and I've never been disappointed. The service is quick and friendly, and the prices are OK (a bit steep but very average for the location). They are great at keeping reservations, which is huge in my book.
Waitresses can get confused with larger groups. But the Saketini is pretty tasty.
The bento boxes are pretty good here.

(Translated by Google) At the time I wanted to eat Korean food, I had a nice meal of sashimi in Araon. Gochujang and kimchi were delicious. Service is good. It is also very accessible because it is located in the Chicago financial district close to Willis Building. The boss is Korean, and you live nicely. I would definitely recommend it to Koreans visiting Chicago.  (Original) 한국 음식이 먹고 싶을 무렵, 아라온에서 회덮밥을 맛있게 먹었습니다. 고추장과 김치도 맛있었구요. 서비스 좋습니다. 윌리스빌딩과도 가까운 시카고 금융가에 있으니까 접근성도 아주 좋습니다. 사장님이 한국분인데, 참 멋있게 사시는군요. 시카고를 방문하는 한국분들께 꼭 추천하고 싶습니다.
Awesome sushi! A bit pricey but if you decide well u can eat for lower prices here , too. Top atmosphere and fine dining. Not a spot for shorts ;)

We walked in and the sushi chef immediately engaged my one and three year old. He brought them out special little kids sushi and rice/miso plates without us asking. At the end he brought them cotton candy. We ve only had this type of treatment of our kids at the ritz carlton.  The waitress was ver attentive.  Great food! Great drinks. Personalized service!

The sushi was incredible.  The owner kept bringing us special samples.  Most definitely coming back here next time I'm in town.  Edit: It's the next time and I went back.  It was well worth it!!  Some of the sushi I had had kimchi in it.  The thought of kimchi doesn't turn me on.  But this was so good.  The flavors blended so well.  So far all that my coworkers and myself have tried has been incredible.  That and the red velvet dessert!!

The food, the sushi in particular, was excellent. The signature was especially good. Also, the dessert was really good (a pear yogurt) that was sweet but not overpowering or overfilling. The service was also excellent and the atmosphere was open but quiet enough to have a conversation.
Amazing food, excellent staff, and fast service!
The best sushi in Chicago!
Amazing sushi, fast service, courteous every step of the way. They even let me keep my reservation when I was late.
Excellent flavors - top notch service. The buckwheat salad was an unexpected treat. The sushi was perfect.
Definitely the best! Someone who wants to experience the best sushi and sasimi, he or she must go there. All other food are excellent too!
Amazing food and service. The sushi chef even came to visit our table with a special treat!
Absolutely the best bulgogi you will have in the city hands down.
The finest dining and the nicest staff around.

My wife and I brought our 6- and 10-year-old daughters to Chicago for spring break. We decided to check out AraOn because it's right across the street from the JW Marriott where we're staying.  When we first walked in, the hostess came across as ever so slightly condescending when she asked if we had reservations - it was Monday night at about 8, and the place was *maybe* half full. She seated us, and she came back to take our order a few minutes later. I asked my wife if she was getting a weird vibe from the hostess/waitress, and my wife had the same impression I did. Nothing overt, but definitely a weird sort of "looking down her nose" feeling.  We started with edamame for us, miso soup for my oldest daughter. The owner of the place came out to bring the edamame, and he was incredibly kind and gracious. The edamame was salted with the standard sea salt, and also spiced with a red crushed pepper. They were very good.  I ordered the Sushi Combo Platter ($26) listed as "chef's selection of 6 pieces of nigiri and a spicy tuna maki." My wife ordered the Miso Yaki salmon bento box ($23). My 10-year-old daughter asked for crab rangoon for her entree, and my 6-year-old just wanted mac and cheese, so we ordered the smoked cheddar and bacon mac and cheese.  The owner came out again to deliver the crab rangoon, and he brought an extra plate for my youngest - great touch to keep the kids from fussing. He was effusive in his welcome, and really nice to all of us.  Then he came out and gave my wife and me a squid salad (not on the menu) to try. The squid was smoky and perfectly prepared, both of us were really impressed.  When our meals came out, I was really blown away by the size of my plate. There was some really beautiful sashimi, tuna, salmon and (I think) yellowtail. There was also a really nice tempura shrimp roll, an eel roll, and five pieces of sushi (salmon, tuna, yellowtail, squid, and I can't remember the 5th piece, sorry). I was not expecting any sashimi at all, and only one roll.  I was amazed at how light and flavorful the sashimi was, and how rich the sushi was. The tempura shrimp roll was perfect, and the eel roll was just... jaw dropping. A lovely touch was that they used sprinkles of real gold leaf on the tuna sashimi. My daughters were fascinated, and I will admit it impressed me. He claimed that eating the gold would purify me. No science to that, but it sounded great.  Now, I am certainly not a sushi connoisseur, but I've had really good sushi all over the globe. This was easily in the top five places at which I've ever eaten sushi & sashimi.  The owner came over a couple of times during the meal to check on us, and he chatted with my daughters easily, bringing them to laughter several times. He really, really did a great job of making us feel welcome.  To top the meal off, he brought us a really unique dessert - an Asian pear sherbet in a bed of ground fresh ginger, resting in a shallow pool of pomegranate juice. He said that it would cleanse the mouth and aid in digestion. It was also really amazing. I've never had a dessert like it before, and it was a beautiful end to a fantastic meal.  When the check came, I finally put it together - I had ordered the "Sushi combo platter ($26)," but they had brought me (and charged me for) the "Ara-On Deluxe Platter ($46)." Normally, I'd have been plenty upset that they brought me a meal almost twice the price of the one I'd ordered, but between the comped squid salad, comped crab rangoon, comped desserts, and personal attention from the owner, I was really not upset about it at all. I choose to believe that it was an honest mistake. Even at nearly twice the price, the Ara-On Deluxe is absolutely worth it. All four of us walked away raving about the place.  I'll definitely be back when I travel here next!
